ygData.subject: Discovery.

* Dinobot growled as he waited for Tavatrons response, his chest seeming to 
come alive with the pain as he stood there.
He winced as the fembot spoke, hearing her words partly but also feeling the 
sudden sharp pain that suddenly sparked up in his chest.
The pain was subtle and quick, yet he knew exactly what it was:
One of his fluid pumps had deactivated, obviously not enough mech-fluid left 
to keep it active.

The pain was quick but it kept repeating itself, almost returning every time 
his spark beat. However, it was tolerable and soon he simply disregarded it, 
becoming nothing more then a shadow thought in the back of his mind as he 
stood there and waited.

He watched her as she stood there and took in the night sounds and smells, 
the pain in his chest continuing to spark up�however, becoming more 
difficult to ignore. He failed to see the expressions of the fembots face as 
he thought of just how it was important it was to get back to base, his mind 
dwelling on that factor so much that he didn�t even noticing when she turned 
her head towards him.
Dinobot�s optics fell upon the stream as he waited silently for Tavatron, 
occupying his time with past thoughts and the importance to leave.

His tail twitched thoughtfully behind him, the past pain of his chest 
forgotten as he continued to relay the route in which they both were 
required to take in order to get back to the CF. It would be difficult and 
it would take time, plenty enough time to be attacked if the enemy decided 
to do so.

That factor made the reptilian warrior growl deeply within his throat, not 
really wanting to consider the conciquesces of being caught as injured as he 
was. The more mech-fluid he lost the less fight time he would have, the 
closer stasis lock drew near.

Dinobot�s optics stayed on the cool reflective surface of the small brook as 
Tavatron�s voice suddenly protruded into his thoughts, her question simple 
but with meaning and concern behind it. *

� I�m fine.�

* His answer was just as cool and collected as the stream his optics gazed 
upon blindly, yet he knew that he shouldn�t lie as he had just done now. But 
there was no need to involve Tavatron in his matters when she didn�t need to 
be, said his thoughts, anyway.

But, just as he finished his short sentence he turned his optics towards 
Tavatron, just wondering if she was ready to go yet�suddenly finding her 
RIGHT in front of him!

His optics refocused quickly, yet too slow to see just what Tavatron had 
just done. Due to his damage, by the time he focused upon her she had 
already brushed her fingers against his chest-plate, hie own optics then 
looking at the mech-fluid dripping from her fingers just as hers did.

In a sense he felt annoyed that she would touch him without his knowing, but 
also he felt that he shouldn�t have lied to her in the first place�and 
indeed brought this contact upon himself.
Dinobot snarled as he then took his eyes from the fembots fluid soaked 
finger tips, turning them towards her face�yet to be forced to refocus hie 
optics�again!

The two bots were face to face now, so close that he could literally feel 
her body heat against his wounded and mech-fluid soaked chest-plate.
Tavatron had never been this close to him before, giving him ample 
opportunity to now see just what secrets her features now held.
From his point of view, she looked slightly detached, and even a bit 
stressed by his opinion. But by escaping from the situation she had been in, 
he couldn�t hold something like that against her.
However, as he simply stood there, to stressed by her closeness and 
half-intrigued, he began to see this fem for what she truly was� a 
sure-footed, confident and actually attractive woman.

And it was that, the level of self-confidence he had never seen before, and 
her beauty that held him in his place while his systems screamed that she 
was far too close and should move away�yet, he did not. The past thoughts of 
their long journey completely forgotten, no blank and with no other thoughts 
other then of how close Tavatron was.

And again, without his knowing�his body had reflexed. Without even knowing 
what he had done, he had reached out and now held her again. His clawed 
hands firmly clamped on either side of her waist, his optics remaining 
focused upon her own.

However, this time he did not catch himself, for, his mind was actually now 
focused on her and was not thinking of such a thing that this would have 
seemed against his nature�and how such closeness usually made him 
uncomfortable.

Dinobot watched Tavatrons lips turn in a smile, and realizing that the smile 
was directed towards him. However, as he glanced deeper into her expression, 
he also saw concern�and that was when his mind finally clicked in. And it 
was also then that he realized what he was doing, which caused him to become 
uncomfortable and questionable.
He heard her speak and knew her words with a new sharpness, his own twice as 
blunt and meaningful.*

� Yes. Agreed.�

* He removed his hands from Tavatron�s waist with haste, silently cursing 
himself for having his guard down.
This wasn�t like him, and it made him uncomfortable�and, thus, aggressive.

How could his mind had gone almost�numb like that, and just because Tavatron 
had been near him?
It was too strange, and something that made him doubt his own self control.

However, little did he know�but he didn�t have time to dwell on the faults 
of his control, not with a missile heading right for his back!
Dinobot stepped away from Tavatron with a meaningful growl, not wanting to 
be near her any longer at the moment. But, he did manage to hear the distant 
sound of a single voice�and heard its words as well.

He snapped his head in the direction of the voice just in time to see Dark 
One, the spineless little gnat he had slaged back at the Alliance.
He saw the laser shots heading right for them, his head then snapping 
towards Tavatron.*

� Quick! To the trees! We�re under attack!!�

* Dinobot then ran a few steps towards the approaching Dark One, taking a 
laser bolt in the arm as he came to a stop.*

� Get to the cover of the trees, they shall have a harder time attacking you 
from there!�

* He called this back over his shoulder towards Tavatron, knowing that the 
trees would be the only form of protection now.
Dinobot then looked back towards the advancing enemy, his systems a bit 
fuzzy as they were but still able to function.

With a sneer he growled and aimed his optic laser towards the approaching 
Alliance bot, his scanners picking up the remainder of the Oblitercon crew 
as he fired towards Dark One�s middle.

He just KNEW that they should have moved out, but he guessed that it was far 
better to be attacked here and not when they would be crossing the swamp.*
